sen.j: 一乗寺駅（いちじょうじえき）は、京都市左京区一乗寺里ノ西町にある叡山電鉄叡山本線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Ichijoji Satononishi-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Ichijoji Station is a stop on Eizan Main Line which is operated by Eizan Electric Railway Co.,Ltd.
Ichijoji Station, located in Ichijoji Satononishi-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a stop on the Eizan Main Line, which is operated by the Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.
Ichijoji Station, located in Ichijoji Satononishi-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a stop on the Eizan Main Line, which is operated by the Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 対面式2面2線のホームを持つ。
sen.e: Ichijoji Station has two separate platforms and two boarding areas.
sen.cmt: ｢対面式2面2線のホーム」とは「対面式（相対式）プラットホームが2つ、乗り場が2つ」という意味であり（Wiki 「プラットホーム」参照）、そこでは「プラットホーム」と「乗り場」を訳し分ける必要があることから、前者を"platform"、後者を"boarding area"としています。
sen.e: Ichijoji Station has two separate platforms and two boarding areas.
Ichijoji Station has with two separate platforms that face each other with two sets of tracks running between.
sen.cmt: ホームの表現を変更しました（～platform with ～ tracksなど）

sen.j: 平素は駅員無配置駅であるが平日の朝と多客時の土日のみ係員が配置される。
sen.e: Basically it is an unmanned stop, but it becomes a manned stop in the weekday morning and on busy weekends.
Basically, it's an unmanned stop, but it becomes a manned stop in the weekday mornings and on busy weekends.
Basically, it's an unmanned stop, but it becomes a manned stop in the weekday mornings and on busy weekends.

sen.j: 出町柳駅行きホームのみ券売機が設置されており、8時から18時30分まで稼動する。
sen.e: An automatic ticket vending machine is set merely on the platform that the train bound for Demachiyanagi Station makes a stop, and the machine works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:30 p.m.
An automatic ticket vending machine is provided only on the platform at which the train bound for Demachiyanagi Station stops, and the machine operates from 8:00 a.m. to 6:30 p.m.
An automatic ticket vending machine is provided only on the platform at which the train bound for Demachiyanagi Station stops, and the machine operates from 8:00 a.m. to 6:30 p.m.

sen.j: 入口はホームの出町柳駅側にあり、「曼殊院道」の踏切に面している。
sen.e: The station entrance is located on the Demachiyanagi Station side of the platform, and the entrance faces the railway crossing of "Manshuin-michi."
The station entrance is located on the Demachiyanagi Station side of the platform, and the entrance faces the railway crossing of "Manshuin-michi."
The station entrance is located on the Demachiyanagi Station side of the platform, and the entrance faces the railway crossing of 'Manshuin-michi.'

sen.j: （ただし、曼殊院へは隣の修学院駅の方が近い。
sen.e: (But Manshu-in Temple is located nearer to the next stop of Shugakuin Station than to Ichijoji Station.)
(However, Manshu-in Temple is located nearer to the next stop--Shugakuin Station--than it is to Ichijoji Station.)
(However, Manshu-in Temple is located nearer to the next stop--Shugakuin Station--than it is to Ichijoji Station.)

sen.j: ）八瀬比叡山口駅・鞍馬駅行きホームはホームのほぼすべてを、出町柳駅行きホームは約1両分の長さの上屋で覆われ、ワンマンカーの乗降口をカバーしている。
sen.e: On the platform that the train bound for Yase-Hieizanguchi Station makes a stop, there is a shed whose length is almost the same as the platform itself, and on the platform that the train bound for Demachiyanagi Station makes a stop, there is a shed whose length is about a car of the train, so the roofs of these sheds shield passengers from the rain or the like when they get on or off the train that is operated without a conductor.

On the platform where the train bound for Yase-Hieizanguchi Station stops, there is a shed whose length is nearly the same as the platform itself, and on the platform where the train bound for Demachiyanagi Station stops, there is a shed whose length is roughly equivalent to a train car, so the roofs of these sheds shield passengers from rain and the like when they get on or off a train that's operated without a conductor.

On the platform where the train bound for Yase-Hieizanguchi Station stops, there is a shed whose length is nearly the same as the platform itself, and on the platform where the train bound for Demachiyanagi Station stops, there is a shed whose length is roughly equivalent to a train car, so the roofs of these sheds shield passengers from rain and the like when they get on or off a train that's operated without a conductor.

sen.j: 上下共にバリアフリーには対応していない。
sen.e: Neither of the platforms is barrier-free.
Neither platform is barrier-free.
Neither platform is barrier-free.

sen.j: 道路からホーム面までの階段のみであるが（画像参照）車椅子等での利用には介護者が必要。
sen.e: There merely exist the steps from the road to the platform (please refer to the image), and the disabled person including one in a wheelchair needs to be assisted to use the steps.
There are only steps from the road to the platform (please refer to the image), so disabled persons--including those in wheelchairs--must be assisted in using the steps.
There are only steps from the road to the platform (please refer to the image), so disabled persons--including those in wheelchairs--must be assisted in using the steps.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 駅は曼殊院道に面し、商店街の中にある。
sen.e: The station faces Manshuin-michi and exists in the midst of a shopping street.
The station faces Manshuin-michi and is situated amid a shopping street.
The station faces Manshuin-michi Road and is situated amid a shopping street.

sen.j: 開設当時から商店が並んでいたが、戦後市場が開設され、曼殊院通にバス路線も通じた。
sen.e: The shops stood there before the opening of the station, and after World War Ⅱ, the market was set up and the bus line was also established on Manshuin-dori Street.
The shops were in place before the opening of the station, and after World War Ⅱ the market was set up and the bus line was established on Manshuin-dori Street.
The shops were in place before the opening of the station, and after World War Ⅱ the market was set up and the bus line was established on Manshuin-dori Street.

sen.j: 1960年代、駅西側は当時都市中心部以外では珍しかった映画館やパチンコ店などを有する商店街、歓楽街として発展した。
sen.e: In 1960s, the western side of the station developed as a shopping street and as an entertainment district including movie theaters and "pachinko parlors," the Japanese pinball parlors, both rare outside of a city's downtown area at that time.

In the 1960s, the west side of the station developed as a shopping street and entertainment district, including movie theaters and "pachinko parlors," the Japanese pinball parlors, both of which were rare outside of city downtown areas at that time.

In the 1960s, the west side of the station developed as a shopping street and entertainment district, including movie theaters and "pachinko parlors," the Japanese pinball parlors, both of which were rare outside of city downtown areas at that time.

sen.j: 1980年頃から衰退し映画館も廃業しているが商店街としての様相は残している。
sen.e: From around 1980, the bustle of the entertainment district has been in decline, and the movie theaters already ended their operation, but the appearance of a shopping street still remains.
The bustle of the entertainment district has been in decline since about 1980, and the movie theaters have closed, but the appearance of a shopping street remains.
The bustle of the entertainment district has been in decline since about 1980, and the movie theaters have closed, but the appearance of a shopping street remains.

sen.j: 現在は、大学生相手の店も目立ち、とりわけ京都ラーメン専門店の多さは、京都有数と言われ、京都ラーメンは全国のラーメンマニアにも知られているほどである。
sen.e: At present, stores for college students are noticeable, and particularly about the specialty stores of Kyoto Ramen, the shopping street is said to rank high in their number in Kyoto, and Kyoto Ramen is well-known to freaks all over Japan.

Currently, stores for college students can be seen, particularly with regard to the specialty stores of Kyoto Ramen; the shopping street is said to rank high in their number in Kyoto, and Kyoto Ramen has fans throughout Japan.

Currently, stores for college students can be seen, particularly with regard to the specialty stores of Kyoto Ramen; the shopping street is said to rank high in their number in Kyoto, and Kyoto Ramen has fans throughout Japan.

sen.j: 付近には詩仙堂、一乗寺下り松など観光名所も多い。
sen.e: Around the station, there are many the sights, such as Shisendo and Ichijoji-Sagarimatsu.
Around the station there are many the sights, such as Shisendo and Ichijoji-Sagarimatsu.
Around the station there are many sightseeing spots, such as Shisen-do Hall and Ichijoji-Sagarimatsu.
sen.cmt: the sights→ sightseeing spotsとしました。

sen.j: 現在の京都市営バスの最寄り停留所は駅から東へ400mほどの白川通に面した「一乗寺下り松町」と、西へ300mほどの東大路通に面した「一乗寺高槻町」である。
sen.e: The present nearest bus stops of Kyoto City Bus to Ichijoji Station are "Ichijoji Sagarimatsucho," which faces Shirakawa-dori Street and is located about four hundred meters to the east of the station, and "Ichijoji Takatsukicho," which faces Higashioji-dori Street and is located about three hundred meters to the west of the station.

Currently, the nearest bus stops of Kyoto City Bus to Ichijoji Station are "Ichijoji Sagarimatsucho," which faces Shirakawa-dori Street and is located about 400 meters east of the station, and "Ichijoji Takatsukicho," which faces Higashioji-dori Street and is located about 300 meters west of the station.

Currently, the nearest bus stops of Kyoto City Bus to Ichijoji Station are 'Ichijoji Sagarimatsu-cho,' which faces Shirakawa-dori Street and is located about 400 meters east of the station, and 'Ichijoji Takatsuki-cho,' which faces Higashioji-dori Street and is located about 300 meters west of the station.

sen.j: 運賃制度区間制となっている叡電の普通運賃であるが、商店街利用者を考慮して当駅～三宅八幡駅を1区としていた時期もあった。
sen.e: The standard fare of Eizan Electric Railway Co.,Ltd. (Eiden) is based on the number of sections, but in consideration of passengers going to the shopping street, the section between Ichijoji Station and Miyakehachiman Station was once handled as a single section.
sen.cmt: 「運賃制度区間制」についてはサンプル翻訳・「叡山鉄道」の90を参照しました。
sen.e: The standard fare of Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd. (Eiden), is based on the number of sections, but in consideration of passengers going to the shopping street, the section between Ichijoji Station and Miyakehachiman Station was once handled as a single entity.

The standard fare of Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd. (Eiden), is based on the number of sections, but in consideration of passengers going to the shopping street, the section between Ichijoji Station and Miyakehachiman Station was once handled as a single entity.

sen.j: 一乗寺下り松 (宮本武蔵 と 吉岡一門 の一乗寺下り松の決闘の場として有名)
sen.e: Ichijoji-Sagarimatsu : A well-known place Musashi MIYAMOTO, one of the greatest master swordsmen in Japanese history, fought a duel with the Yoshioka family
Ichijoji-Sagarimatsu: This is a well-known place where Musashi MIYAMOTO, one of the greatest swordsmen in Japanese history, fought a duel with an opponent from the Yoshioka family.
Ichijoji-Sagarimatsu: This is a well-known place where Musashi MIYAMOTO, one of the greatest swordsmen in Japanese history, fought a duel with an opponent from the Yoshioka family.

sen.j: 詩仙堂
sen.e: Shisendo
Shisendo
Shisen-do Hall

sen.j: 狸谷山不動院
sen.e: Tanukidanisan Fudo-in Temple
Tanukidanisan Fudo-in Temple
Tanukidanisan Fudo-in Temple

sen.j: 恵文社一乗寺店（美術書などで有名な書店）
sen.e: Keibunsha Co.,Ltd. Ichijoji Branch (a famous bookstore for handling art books and others)
The Ichijoji branch of Keibunsha Co., Ltd., a famous bookstore specializing in art books and others
The Ichijoji branch of Keibunsha Co., Ltd., a famous bookstore specializing in art books and others

sen.j: 餃子の王将一乗寺店（チェーン設立時の1店）
sen.e: Gyoza no Osho (Osho Food Service Corporation) Ichijoji Branch (one of the stores set up at the foundation of the chain)
sen.cmt: 翻訳仕様書に従い、「王将」は"Osho"としています。
sen.e: Gyoza no Osho (Osho Food Service Corporation) Ichijoji Branch (one of the stores set up at the founding of the chain)
Gyoza no Ohsho (Ohsho Food Service Corporation) Ichijoji Branch (one of the stores set up at the founding of the chain)
sen.cmt: 王将は会社の正式表記はOhshoですので、左記のようにしました。

sen.j: 京都市立修学院中学校
sen.e: Kyoto Municipal Shugakuin Junior High School
Kyoto Municipal Shugakuin Junior High School

sen.j: 京都市立修学院第二小学校
sen.e: Kyoto Municipal Shugakuin Second Elementary School
Kyoto Municipal Shugakuin Second Elementary School
Kyoto Municipal Shugakuin Daini (second) Elementary School

sen.j: 珍遊（一日乗車券「えぇきっぷ」で特典が得られるラーメン店）
sen.e: Chinyu : A ramen store where you can get a discount or the like by using One-day Pass for Eizan Railways "Ee Kippu"
Chinyu: A ramen store where you can get a discount or the like by using the One-day Pass for Eizan Railways "Ee Kippu"

sen.j: 1925年（大正14年）9月27日 京都電燈の駅として開業。
sen.e: September 27, 1925 -- Ichijoji Station opened as a stop of Kyoto Dento.
September 27, 1925: Ichijoji Station opened as a stop of Kyoto Dento.
September 27, 1925: Ichijoji Station opened as a stop of Kyoto Dento.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）3月2日 会社譲渡により京福電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: March 2, 1942 -- Ichijoji Station became a stop of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co.,Ltd. because of the transfer of operations.
sen.cmt: 「会社譲渡」とは「営業譲渡」のことと解され、そのように訳しています。(「営業譲渡」については英辞郎 on the WEB を参照し"transfer of operations"としました。）
sen.e: March 2, 1942: Ichijoji Station became a stop of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., due to the transfer of operations.
March 2, 1942: Ichijoji Station became a stop of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., due to the transfer of operations.

sen.j: 1986年（昭和61年）4月1日 会社譲渡により叡山電鉄の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1986 -- Ichijoji Station became a stop of Eizan Electric Railway Co.,Ltd. because of the transfer of operations.
April 1, 1986: Ichijoji Station became a stop of Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd., upon the transfer of operations.
April 1, 1986: Ichijoji Station became a stop of Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd., upon the transfer of operations.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。
